Welcome

A Digital Repository of Explorations and Creations

Welcome to the online home of J.G. Landje. This website serves as a personal archive and public-facing collection of my diverse intellectual and creative endeavors. Here, you will find a variety of content reflecting my interests in literature, philosophy, software development, culinary arts, and esoteric studies.

Featured Sections:

  • Essays: Delve into my thoughts and reflections on a range of subjects. This section contains my written explorations of various ideas and concepts.

  • Books: Discover a collection of digital publications I have prepared, including Richard Wilhelm’s German translations of the Daodejing and the Zhuangzi, as well as previously unavailable EPUB versions of works by Aleister Crowley.

  • Recipes: Explore my culinary adventures and find inspiration for your own kitchen with a collection of recipes I enjoy.

About Me: To learn more about my background, interests, and motivations, please visit the About Me page.

Contact: If you wish to get in touch, please find my contact information on the Contact page.

Thank you for visiting. I invite you to explore the various sections of this website and engage with the content provided.

Latest Essays

  • The Failure of Multiculturalism: Ancient Warnings for Modern Europe
    Mar 28, 2025
    This essay critically examines how multiculturalism has undermined Europe's cultural unity by drawing parallels with ancient Rome. It weaves together insights from classical philosophers like Aristotle, Plato, Cicero, and Seneca with the traditionalist critique of Julius Evola to argue that the erosion of a common cultural identity leads to societal fragmentation and decline.
  • Revolt and Aftermath: The 1968 Generation’s Legacy and the Descent into 'Woke Fascism'
    Mar 27, 2025
    A rhetorical treatise examining how the 1968 generation’s rejection of tradition fostered extreme individualism and paved the way for modern ideological fragmentation, drawing on the wisdom of Cicero, Plato, Seneca, Aristotle, and Cato.
  • A New Philosophy
    Mar 21, 2025
    Weaving together Daoism, Nietzschean Thought, Thelema & Cosmicism
  • The Enduring Wisdom of the Way: Daoist Philosophy and Its Relevance in Modern Life
    Mar 17, 2025
  • The Dao of Simplicity in Frontend Design
    Mar 17, 2025
